** I have an idea I believe others might love. I know I would! **

Briefly, I'd like to begin with how this idea came to me (as I feel it helps support the idea itself!)

I'd aimed to do 30 days of yoga. I'd tried this a few times before and kept failing and I was upset with myself for that, so this time I wanted to get it nailed down and I wanted to prove to myself I could do it. Challenges I could foresee that could lead to failure: I've gotten a lot of migraines in life or sometimes am just super tired and wasn't sure how I'd manage yoga on days like this but I sought for answers and then I got the idea to just do super gentle and short practices if those times happened, or even lie in Savasana if I had a super bad migraine. This plan helped me to finally succeed! I only had one headache day during the 30 days (today is day 32!) and it wasn't even very bad, and I had a few times where I needed something short and gentle just due to my headspace or body needs at the time. For these, I sought out your bedtime yoga videos that were on the shorter side.

A few show up when I do this search and so here is my idea that I believe others would love too:

It would be amazing if there were simply more of these stretchy (even like this video here that was posted yesterday) on the ground, gentle practice videos in varying short lengths (7-8 minutes - 10-11-12 minutes - 14-15-16 minutes - 17-18-20 minutes - 22-24-26 minutes) so there could be a bigger selection of the varying length times for this type of yoga practice. These kinds of practices stand out easiest to me when they are labeled as bed-time yoga, as then I figure you really aren't going to have me doing planks or warrior poses, etc (which I do love as well for those times I love them, but def not for when I'm just not feeling great for whatever reason that's the case).

I then got this idea!!!!

What if you did another 30 days of yoga series - but this could be 30 nights of yoga for bedtime! And everything in it could be of different lengths that aren't super long and they could be slow and gentle and stretchy - just for really calming down for bed for 30 nights straight! We could all practice a nightly routine for 30 days to calm us and center us and help us sleep better and then there'd be all those night-time videos to add to the collection of clearly labeled super gentle yoga practices for times also when we don't feel our best but still wish to stay with our commitment to a daily practice.

Anyway, it's just an idea and I don't know how challenging it is or isn't for you to plan and then execute a 30-day of yoga videoing spree.
